intro: Microchilus tessellatus, commonly known as the tessellated moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its intricate, mosaic-like arrangement of leaf-like structures, which give it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its small, delicate leaves are usually arranged in a dense, compact form. Microchilus tessellatus plays a vital role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its native habitats.
